title: Sri Lanka sells all offered Treasury bills, 3-months 23.53-pct
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka has sold 87.5 billion rupees of Treasury bills, the full offered volume 3-month bills drawing the most interest, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 78.7 billion rupees of 3-month bills at 23.53 percent, up 32 basis points from last week.
Only 1.1 billion rupees of 6-month bills were sold at 23.96 percent down from 24.77 percent a week earlier.
Another 7.6 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 24.09 percent down from 24.36 percent a week earlier.
Market participants say there is strong interest in Treasury bills from clients and money is starting to flow into debt markets.
It is not clear how much of the bills were held by the central bank.

It is not necessary to sell bills held by the central bank, since the exchange regime is still broken, analysts say. Sales of central bank held bills will have to be re-financed at the 14.5 percent window, altering rupee reserves of individual banks. (Colombo/Apr27/2022)
